PGsequentialmacros.pl

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00002 =head1 NAME
00003 
00004     PGsequentialmacros.pl 
00005     
00006 Provides support for writing sequential problems, where certain parts
00007 of the problem are hidden until earlier questions are answered correctly.
00008 
00009 
00010 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00011 
00012     The basic sequential problem structure:
00013 
00014     DOCUMENT();          
00015     loadMacros(.....);   
00016     ## first segment ##                 
00017     BEGIN_TEXT
00018         The first question: Enter \(sin(0) = \) \{ans_rule\}.
00019     END_TEXT
00020     ANS(num_cmp(0));
00021     if (@incorrect_answers = get_incorrect_answers( ) ) {
00022           TEXT( "These answers are not correct  ", join(" ",@incorrect_answers),$BR); 
00023           foreach my $label (@incorrect_answers) {
00024               checkAnswer($label,debug=>1);
00025           }
00026     }
00027     if (all_answers_are_correct() ) {
00028           TEXT("$PAR Right! Now for the next part of the problem");
00029     } else {
00030          STOP_RENDERING();
00031     }
00032     ## second segment ##    
00033          ....
00034     if (@incorrect_answers = get_incorrect_answers( ) ) {
00035           TEXT( "These answers are not correct  ", join(" ",@incorrect_answers),$BR); 
00036           foreach my $label (@incorrect_answers) {
00037               checkAnswer($label,debug=>1);
00038           }
00039     }
00040     if (all_answers_are_correct() ) {
00041           TEXT("$PAR Right! Now for the next part of the problem");
00042     } else {
00043          STOP_RENDERING();
00044     }
00045     ## third segment ## 
00046     ENDDOCUMENT()        # must be the last statement in the problem
00047 
00048 
00049 
00050 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00051 
00052 
00053 =cut

00056 =head2  listFormVariables
00057 
00058     listFormVariables();
00059     listVariables();
00060 
00061 Lists all variables submitted in the problem form and all variables in the 
00062 the Problem environment.  This is used for debugging.
00063 
00064 =cut
00065 
00066 sub listVariables {
00067     listFormVariables(@_);
00068 }
00069 
00070 sub listFormVariables {
00071     # Lists all of the variables filled out on the input form
00072     # Useful for debugging
00073     TEXT($HR,"Form variables", );
00074     TEXT(pretty_print($inputs_ref));
00075     # list the environment variables
00076     TEXT("Environment",$BR);
00077    TEXT(pretty_print(\%envir));
00078    TEXT($HR);
00079 }
00080 
00081 =head2  checkAnswer
00082 
00083 
00084     checkAnswer($label);
00085 
00086 Checks the answer to the question labeled C<$label>.  The result is 1 if the answer is completely correct.
00087 0 if the answer is wrong or partially wrong and undefined if that question has not yet
00088 been answered. (Specifically if no answer hash is produced when the answer is evaluated
00089 by the corresponding answer evaluator.)
00090 
00091 =cut
00092 
00093 sub checkAnswer {
00094     # checks an answer on a given answer evaluator.
00095     my $answerName = shift;  # get the name of the answer
00096     my $ans_eval        = get_PG_ANSWERS_HASH($answerName),;   # get the answer evaluator
00097     my %options         = @_;
00098     my $debug =($options{debug})?1:0;  # give debug information
00099 
00100     my $answer = $main::inputs_ref->{$answerName};
00101     my $response = undef;
00102     if (defined($answer) and defined($ans_eval) ) {
00103         my $rh_ans_hash = $ans_eval->evaluate($answer);
00104                 $response = (defined($rh_ans_hash) and 1 == $rh_ans_hash->{score}) ? 1:0;
00105         TEXT("result of evaluating $answerName",$BR, pretty_print($rh_ans_hash) ) if $debug;
00106     } else {
00107          warn "Answer evaluator for answer $answerName is not defined" unless defined($ans_eval);
00108          # it's ok to have a blank answer.
00109     }
00110     return $response;   # response is (undef => no answer, 1=> correct answer, 0 => not completely correct
00111 }
00112 
00113 =head2 listQueuedAnswers
00114 
00115     listQueuedAnswers();
00116 
00117 Lists the labels of the answer blanks which have been printed so far.
00118 The return value is a string which can be printed.  This is mainly
00119 used for debugging.
00120 
00121 =cut
00122 
00123 
00124 sub listQueuedAnswers {
00125         # lists the names of the answer blanks so far;
00126         my %pg_answers_hash = get_PG_ANSWERS_HASH();
00127         join(" ", keys %pg_answers_hash);
00128 }
00129 
00130 =head2 checkQueuedAnswers
00131 
00132     checkQueuedAnswers();
00133 
00134 Returns a hash whose key/value pairs are the labels of the questions
00135 have been printed so far and the scores obtained by evaluating the 
00136 answers to these questions.
00137 
00138 =cut
00139 
00140 sub checkQueuedAnswers {
00141        # gather all of the answers submitted up to this time
00142       my %options = @_;
00143       my $debug = ($options{debug}) ? 1 :0;
00144       my (%pg_answers_hash) = get_PG_ANSWERS_HASH();
00145       my %scores=();
00146       foreach $label (keys %pg_answers_hash) {
00147              $scores{$label}=checkAnswer($label,  debug=>$debug);
00148       }
00149      %scores;
00150 }
00151 
00152 =head2  all_answers_are_correct
00153 
00154     all_answers_are_correct();
00155 
00156 Returns 1 if there is at least one answer and all of the questions
00157 printed so far have been answered correctly.
00158 
00159 =cut
00160 
00161 sub all_answers_are_correct{
00162      # return 1 if all scores are 1, else it returns 0;
00163      # returns 0 if no answers have been checked yet
00164      my %scores = checkQueuedAnswers();
00165      return 0 unless %scores;
00166      my $result =1;
00167      foreach my $label (keys %scores) { if (not defined($scores{$label}) or $scores{$label} <1) {$result=0; last;} };  
00168      $result;
00169 }
00170 
00171 =head2  get_incorrect_answers
00172 
00173     get_incorrect_answers();
00174 
00175 Returns a list of labels of questions which have been printed and have
00176 been answered incorrectly.  This list does NOT include blank or undefined
00177 answers.  It's possible for the returned list to be empty AND for all_answers_are_correct()
00178 to return false.
00179 
00180 =cut
00181 
00182 sub get_incorrect_answers {
00183     # returns only incorrect answers, not blank or undefined answers.
00184     my %scores = checkQueuedAnswers();
00185     my @incorrect = ();
00186     foreach my $label (keys %scores) {push( @incorrect, $label) 
00187           unless  (not defined($scores{$label}) or $scores{$label}==1  )
00188     };
00189     @incorrect;
00190 }
00191 
00192 1;
